## The Tidyverse

To install the tidyverse package use the code:

`"install.packages("tidyverse")`.

```{r}
# loading the tidyverse package 
library(tidyverse)
```

We also installed other packages by typing it in the console the following code:

`install.packages(c("arrow", "babynames", "curl", "duckdb", "gapminder", "ggrepel", "ggridges", "ggthemes", "hexbin", "janitor", "Lahman", "leaflet", "maps", "nycflights13", "openxlsx", "palmerpenguins", "repurrrsive", "tidymodels", "writexl"))`

# Data Visualization

::: callout-note
## Reminder

First load the `tidyverse` package.
:::

```{r}
#|label: load-packages
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggthemes)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins)
```

## First Steps

```{r}
penguins
```

```{r}
glimpse(penguins)
```

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| echo: false

ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g)
) +
  geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species)) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(
    title = "Body mass and flipper length",
    subtitle = "Dimensions for Adelie, Chinstrap, and Gentoo Penguins",
    x = "Flipper length (mm)", y = "Body mass (g)",
    color = "Species", shape = "Species"
  ) +
  scale_color_colorblind()
ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = island)
) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE)


```

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| echo: false

ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = bill_depth_mm)
) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE)

ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = bill_depth_mm)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()

ggplot() +
  geom_point(
    data = penguins,
    mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = bill_depth_mm)) +
  geom_smooth(
    data = penguins,
    mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = bill_depth_mm))

```
